title: lost addresses and folders
content: A week ago my whole computer went kaput. I pay for cloud back-up so everything except Thunderbird was fully restored. I know noting about computers. My friend, an IT pro who built and sold me this machine, has worked hard without success. This is my home desktop machine running Windows 10. I can access incoming mail through AT&T Yahoo Mail. And today some kind AT&T person spent two hours with me on the phone. Now I have a newly assigned security code and, to my surprise, a functioning Thunderbird. However, my hundreds of addresses have not reappeared nor have the thousands of saved emails in my various local folders. I believe what I have now is a newer version of Thunderbird. Much of it looks different. And weirdly there was a button for "old email" that I hit and started to receive things sent to me as far back as 2007. I think it stopped at some capacity limit. I am sure most of what came through I don't want but I certainly don't want to permanently delete things I may have moved to another folder. The AT&T person got me to some repair page with step-by-step instructions for hooking up with Thunderbird but he got stymied at some point. I am at a loss here and would appreciate help. Thank you for your time and attention.
creator: kamholzmarvels

Is that possible?

title: Getting Filelink to work in Thunderbird - help please
content:
I use the latest Thunderbird on the latest (Sonoma) MacOS. Whichever filelink service I try to add (in Settings > Composition > Attachments) that service appears with an exclamation mark in a yellow triangle (and I am unable to send links to large files). I thought that for Dropbox and for Box that might have been as a result of the limited file sizes allowed to be sent using my free accounts. However, for Thunderbird Send, WebDAV and *cloud after clicking "Add to Thunderbird" and then clicking "Add" to provide permissions I also get the same exclamation mark error indication. (refer image 1)

Perhaps the problem is related to selecting "Create link for Send service instance" (refer image 2) - I can't make the selection stick - when I close the tab and reopen it, that option is unselected.

What am I doing wrong or not doing? Help appreciated.
creator: werner115

title: Problem Downloading Email in IMAP
content:
Hi, After migrating email server, I am having problems synchronizing some IMAP accounts, but Thunderbird is unable to organize the emails and it corrupts the display. In Webmail it is normal and I have no problems accessing it. Coincidence or not, but the emails that are causing this problem are emails that have more than 80Gb. What I did to see if it would improve, was to divide the emails into folders by year, to reduce the size of the email occupancy, but it didn't work. At first, right when I implemented it, they asked to modify this configuration:

Edit → Preferences → Advanced → General → Configuration Editor. Follow the procedure: Locate a key called: mailnews.customDBHeaders Change it to: Received After that restart the application --> Right click on the folder and go to Properties --> Repair Folder

This worked for a few days, but then it started having problems and even repairing the folder, but it didn't help. What they told me was an issue with Thunderbird reading email data on their server, but the problem continued. They kind of "washed" their hands, since it's ok on their server and asked to test it on another email client. Has anyone experienced this problem? Attached is an image of what the email looks like, there are several with the data that I asked to repair, but empty. I've already updated to the latest version of Thunderbird, but it's still like this.
creator: fernando63

title: Getting back my email contents (window)
content:
In an effort to rid myself of a bug in Thunderbird ver115 I just installed ver127 on a seperate computer. I know there's a version 128 available but according to reports here on the forum, ver128 seems to suffer from the same probielm that I'm seeing in 115 - so for the time being, it's ver 127.

Until now I've been used to seeing a list of emails in the upper half of Thunderbird's window and also seeing the email contents in a lower window (see attached screenshot). But in ver127 I only see the upper list and I don't see the email contents if I click on them. Anyway to get the contents window back?

creator: john391

title: Mapnaam voor mails veranderen wordt niet gesynchroniseerd
content:
Als ik op een PC een mapnaam verander, wordt die verandering niet doorgevoerd op een andere PC waar ik ook in Thunderbiurd ben ingelogd. Vaak leidt dit ertoe, dat de veranderde map op de 2e PC niet meer toegankelijk is. In een aantal gevallen wordt dan de veranderde map getoond als een paars ikoontje in portret richting, i.p.v. een gele map in landschap (zie screenshot 1).

Als de oorspronkelijke folder al submappen had, worden deze grijs getoond in de OUDE map. Zie screenshot 2: ik heb de mapnaam "Kopen overig" veranderd in "Kopen algemeen". Daarna worden zowel de oude als de nieuwe map getoond, waarbij de submappen in de oude map blijven staan, met de naam in grijs.

Dit probleem is behoorlijk lastig in de praktijk, omdat mappen op de andere PC vaak niet toegankelijk zijn.

Ik houd me aanbevolen voor mogelijke oplossingen!

Met dank alvast!
creator: Hherrmmann

title: Transferring Account Setup Info to a Second Computer
content:
I have about a dozen accounts set up on my laptop. I want to have the same accounts on this desktop system. I am loathe to do so by using the standard Tools > Account Setup process because every time I have done so in the past several months, I've had validation problems with the email servers at the ISPs. I've had to change every password to create baseline values before TB could add them even though I had valid passwords copied from a password vault program.

Is there a way to just copy or transfer the data from the laptop to this desktop? I have a couple of the accounts set up here but would like to bring the others over without having to go through the setup steps.
creator: rabbithutch1

title: Old problem figured out - outgoing mail password requested but nothin in outbox
content:
I finally figured out what was causing the problem from this, old question.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1411081

I have filters set to auto-forward mail to another email account. Apparently when you have a forwarding filter, it does not add those messages to the outbox.
creator: mmaurer

title: Thunderbird choking on deleted domain
content:
Hello:

I allowed one of my domains to expire recently, but forgot to remove the account from Thunderbird (TB). Since the domain no longer exists, TB is choking--to the extent that I am unable to access the menu (i.e, File | Work Offline or Settings.)

I have been trying to start TB offline using the Profile Manager, setting the default profile to Work Offline, but that doesn't work. I have use the command line parameter "-safe-mode", but that has no effect. I found an ancient (18 years old) forum post that mentioned a "-offline" parameter, but that too had no effect.

I've been looking for a way to manually edit the profile, but haven't found anything.

I am really stumped. Any assistance/insights into this issue would be greatly appreciated.

Patrick
creator: patrick210

title: Junk Mail ByeBye
content:
Xpunge no longer works since the Thunderbird update; the new one won't be ready until sometime in Sept. (hopefully). I installed the only other add-on that looks as though it should be able to get rid of what's in my junk mail folders. However, I can find no information on it.

It says it's in its own folder, but I can't find it anywhere. It doesn't seem to work automatically and I can't seem to refuse permission for it to read and move my messages (or any other permissions). Does anyone know anything about this? With Xpunge I clicked on it and all of the messages in my junk and/or trash folders (my choice) were deleted; that's what I'm looking for.

1. Where can I find it? It isn't on the toolbar. 2. Can I expect it to automatically move messages to my junk mail folder -- messages that I don't want junked? 3. Will it delete all of the mail in the junk folders of all of my accounts or just move mail to the junk folders? I'm computer-based.

title: How to sort by number of messages from Sender?
content:
I'm doing a major cleanup of old Gmail email messages. I want to quickly find the senders that have the most number of messages.

In Thunderbird, I set the view to All Mail, and then display in Card View. I'm sorting by From, and Grouped By Sort.

This gives me a useful view, but I can not find a way to sort by number of messages (in other words to display the senders in order based on the total number of emails from that sender and show me the number of messages.)

Is there a way to do this in Thunderbird? If not, are there any other tools/email clients that will give me a view like this?

Thank you.
creator: mlondon1
